titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Cole Porter Papers, 1943-1971
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Cole Porter Papers, M0209, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, radio scripts, manuscripts, notes, tapes, reviews of productions, photographs, periodicals, and clippings.

did.unittitle: Cole, James Omar (). Cousin of Cole Porter.
Egan, Tully (). Cole Porter's West Coast Secretary.
Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton, and Garrison. 1965.
[1965](1), excerpt of part of letter, typed by James Cole.
1952(1), card from Linda Porter's dog, Gracie, in Linda Porter's handwriting.
Rathbun, Lee Colgate (). Mrs. Porter's niece. 1954.
Smith, Madeline P. (). Cole Porter's Secretary.
Southern California, University Of. Kate and Cole Porter Memorial
Smith, Madeline, What It's Like To Be Secretary To a Famous Man, 2 pp. carbon typescript, 2 copies.
Cole Porter memo re Born To Dance, a film made in 1936.
COLE PORTER'S PROGRESS, short by George Eells, xerox of typescript.
Parke Bernet Auction Catalog of Cole Porter Memorabilia.

dsc.head: Books received with Cole Porter Collection but now shelved elsewhere

did.unittitle: Boucicault, Dion L., The Yale University Dramatic Association Acting Version Of London Assurance, New Haven, 1910.annotated.
Calahan, Harold Augustin, Geography For Grown-Ups, New York, Harper, 1946.Inscribed For Judy From Pep
Crosby, Caresse, The Passionate Years, New York, Dial, 1953.Cole Porter letter, 9/1/53 in front. [Letter is in the collection]
Harriman, Margaret Chase, Take Them Up Tenderly, New York, Knopf, 1945.not inscribed.
Hubler, Richard G., (as told to), The Cole Porter Story, New York, World, 1965.not inscribed.
Lawrence, Gertrude, A Star Danced, Garden City, Doubleday, 1945.Inscribed Aug. 24, 1945/ Dear Kitty/ I hope you enjoy this./ Sincerely/ Cole Porter
Vertes, It's All Mental, New York, Tudor, 1948.Inscribed by Vertes, and Paul Louis ---. inscribed to Cole Porter
